citation.article-title: Pseudomonas segetis sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas segetis sp. nov.
Pseudomonas segetis (se.ge′tis. L. n. seges soil; L. gen. n. segetis of the soil).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, motile, rod-shaped, 1.1–1.3 μm in length and 0.7–0.8 μm in width.
Colonies on NA are translucent, butyrous, cream-coloured, circular, convex and usually 1–2 mm in diameter after 2 days growth at 30 °C.
Grows at temperatures between 4 and 35 °C, but not at 37 °C.
Tolerates NaCl at concentrations up to 5 % on NA.
Grows very poorly under anaerobic conditions (anaerobic chamber containing CO2/H2/N2 at 10 : 10 : 80, by vol.).
Does not produce fluorescent pigment on King B medium.
Other characteristics are given in Table 1.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 0 and C18 : 1 (Table 2).
The DNA G+C content is 56.3 mol%.
The type strain, strain FR1439T (=IMSNU 14101T=CIP 108523T=KCTC 12331T), was isolated from soil at Dokdo, Republic of Korea.
